formalText: She stated that she is a bit worried that by having this conversation with me, she is changing the view I have of James.
She is having trouble with her marriage because of her depression. James and her had a pretty big fight in the other the other night, which she says was good
"it helped us talk more about not being where we wanted to be together"

She says she is angry at him, but it is  hard to hold on to being angry. An example of what James would say was "I am so angry at you because you left me and I'm really glad that you didn't kill yourself" because she has been thinking of doing so.
She feels like she is doing everything that she can to make things better.
They talked about how in order to care for themselves as a couple right now, she needs to take care of herself which is what she is doing.
She said, "I don't think he's glad to be married to me at this point".
She is struggling to figure out how to say that they need to get back into marriage counseling.
James does not want to talk about his work with her anymore.
She said "I know it's been hard being married to me".
She said, "It's taking me a long time to process things.
